Package gov.nasa.jpl.ammos.mpsa.aerie.merlinsdk.resources

Definitions for constructing time-varying resources.

A mission resource is an entity whose details may vary over the course of the mission, and which influences the success of the mission in some way.

At any given time, a resource is in a given state, and its time-varying behavior -- its dynamics -- depends only upon that state. The Resource interface defines this relationship between state and dynamics.

Multiple resources may be determined by the same shared state. Such resources are defined by a model which determines the dynamics of each of the coupled resources. Thus, a resource is defined by a model. (We include singlet resources -- resources whose state is not shared by others -- as a limiting case.)

Pragmatically, a dynamics at one time may not be a reasonable approximation at a later time. A resource, then, also gives the current extent of validity for its current dynamics. The DelimitedDynamics class describes this mechanism.

We may analyze a resource's dynamics in one of two ways:

  • Determining the value of a resource at a given time, under its current dynamics; or
  • Determining the Windows of time over which some condition is held true.

The Solver interface captures these capabilities for a given choice of types for resource values, dynamics, and conditions.

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Resource<Model,​Dynamics>
    An assignment of a dynamics to a resource given the state of its governing model.
    Solver<Resource,​Dynamics,​Condition>
    A solver over a continuous dynamics for a resource type and conditions against that resource.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DelimitedDynamics<Dynamics>
